meanings.sent1: During the game, he always bogarts the ball and doesn't let others play.
meanings.sent2: She bogarts all the attention in class by constantly talking.
meanings.sent3: At the picnic, he bogarts all the sandwiches, leaving none for the rest of us.
meanings.sent4: The greedy squirrel bogarts all the nuts in the park, not sharing with others.
meanings.sent5: The bully bogarts the swings at the playground, not allowing anyone else to use them.

meanings.definition: A person who hogs or monopolizes something
meanings.sent1: She is such a bogarts when it comes to sharing her toys.
meanings.sent2: The boss is a bogarts in meetings, never letting others speak.
meanings.sent3: The movie star was called a bogarts for always demanding the best dressing room.
meanings.sent4: The rich man was known as a bogarts in the town for buying up all the land.
meanings.sent5: The older brother was a bogarts with the TV remote, never letting his siblings choose the channel.
